greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = binomial(2*n-1,n)*(-1)^n for n>0; a(0) = 1.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
formula: a(n) = A110555(2*n,n), central terms in triangle A110555;
E.g.f.: E(x) = 1 - x/(G(0)+2*x) ; G(k) = (k+1)^2 - 2*x*(2*k+1) + 2*x*(2*k+3)*((k+1)^2)/G(k+1) ; (continued fraction). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, Dec 21 2011
a(n) = coefficient of x^n of (1 / (1 + x))^n where 1 / (1 + x) is the g.f. of A033999. - _Michael Somos_, May 21 2013
HANKEL transform is A000027. HANKEL transform of a(n+1) is A033999(n+1). - _Michael Somos_, May 21 2013
mathematica: a[ n_] := (-1)^n Binomial[ 2 n - 1, n] (* _Michael Somos_, May 21 2013 *)
a[ n_] := Binomial[ -n, -2 n] (* _Michael Somos_, May 21 2013 *)
a[ n_] := SeriesCoefficient[(1 + x)^-n, {x, 0, n}] (* _Michael Somos_, May 21 2013 *)
program: (PARI) {a(n) = if( n<0, 0, polcoeff( (1 + x)^-n + x * O(x^n), n))} /* _Michael Somos_, May 21 2013 */
xref: Another version of A001700, which is the main entry. Cf. A000984, A007318.
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jul 27 2005
